pageContext.claim: “These are all people that you have to see the recommendations. I rely on recommendations [for pardons], very importantly.”
pageContext.analysis: In issuing pardons, Trump has sidelined the Office of the Pardon Attorney in the Justice Department, relying instead on Fox News hosts and well-connected friends. "Under Trump, the pardon office has become a bureaucratic way station, according to government data and interviews with lawyers, criminal justice advocates, and former pardon and White House officials," The Washington Post reported. "Most of Trump’s grants of clemency have gone to ­well-connected offenders who had not filed petitions with the pardon office or did not meet its requirements."
